section.name: About this Guide
section.p: The OpenEdge User Guide is intended to help developers get acquainted with the OpenEdge Maverick Framework. If you have any suggestions or comments please feel free to post them to the list.

section.name: Overview
section.p: The OpenEdge Maverick Framework is a small framework on top of Maverick, Velocity, OpenEdge Modules and OpenEdge Access. The main aim of the framework is to provide basic functionality, such as error handling and authentication, that'll give you a headstart when developping a web application.

Key features are:
Extends Maverick and Velocity for custom error handling
Initializes OpenEdge Modules and OpenEdge Acess. You can use OpenEdge Modules as your component repository and OpenEdge Access for JAAS based authentication/ authorization.
Provides some utility methods and overridable default behavior that can be used when developing a web application.
